subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Three lawyers accused of bilking their clients in a diet drug settlement must repay at least $62.1 million in settlement funds and interest, a judge in Louisville, Ky., ruled Friday.Special Judge William Wehr ordered William J. Gallion, 56, Shirley A. Cunningham Jr., 52, and Melbourne Mills Jr., 76, to repay $42 million taken from the settlement and $20.1 million in interest. The lawyers are being sued by about 400 former clients who claim they took too much money as part of a $200 million fen-phen settlement. Gallion and Cunningham own a 20 percent stake in Curlin, who won the second leg of the Triple Crown in May.
